metadata.title: CVE-2020-35113 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Mozilla developers reported memory safety bugs present in Firefox 83 andFirefox ESR 78.5. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruptionand we presume that with enough effort some of these could have beenexploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 84,Thunderbird < 78.6, and Firefox ESR < 78.6.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-35113` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 84.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 84.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 84.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '84.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
